div.l: A fals traytour͗e fals clerk qduod he
Thou schalt be dede be goddis dignite
Who durste be so bolde to disꝑparage
My doȝht̉er þat is comen̄ of swiche lynage
And by þe throte boll he cauȝht Aleyne
And he hente hym despitouslydesitouslydespitously a gayne
And on þe nose he smote hym with his fiste
Down̄ ranne þe blody streme opon his breste
And in þe flore with nose and mouthe to broke
Þei walowed as doith þe pigges in a poke
And up þei gone and down̄ a gayn̄ onon̄
Till þat þe Miller spurned at a stone
And down̄ he fill bakwarde vp on his wyffe
That wiste no thynge of þis nyce stryfe
For sche was falle a slepe a litill wyȝht
With Iohn þe Clerke þat waked had al þe nyȝht
And with þe fall oute of hir͗e slepe sche braide
Help holy crosse of bromholme sche seide
In manus tuas lorde to þe I calle
A wake symonde þe fende is on me falle
Myne hert is broken̄ I ne am but dede
Ther͗e lieth one up my wombe and vp myn̄ hede
Helpe symkyn̄ for þe fals clerkes fiȝȝht
This Iohn sterte up as faste as euer he myȝhte
And grasped by þe walles both to and froo
To fynden̄ a staffe and sche stirte up also
And knewe þe Estr͗es bett̉er þan did þat Iohn
And by þe walle a staff sche fonde onon̄
And sawe a litill schimerynge of a liȝht
For at an hole in schone þe mone brygth
And by þat liȝht sche sawe hem both twoo
But sikerly scho nyst who was whoo
But as sche sawe a white thynge in hir͗e eye
And whan̄ sche gan̄ þis whyte thynge aspie
She wende þe Clerke had wered a voluper
And with þe staff sche drough ay ner͗e and ner͗e
And wente han hitte þis aleyn̄ at þe full
And smote þe miller͗e on þe pilled skull
That down̄ he goith and cried harrowe I dye
Thise clerkꝭes bet hym wele and lete hym lye
And graythen̄ hem and toke her͗e horse a non̄
And eke her͗e mele and on her͗e waye þei gone
And at þe Mille ȝit þai toke her cake
Of half a busshell of flour full wele y bake
Thus is þe proude Miller͗e wele y bete
